subject: Leadership
title: Systems Thinking
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Systems Thinking.

hook.text: A city builds more highways to reduce traffic. Traffic gets worse. More roads invited more cars. They missed the system.

buildup.text: Systems thinking means seeing how parts interact rather than analyzing them in isolation. Everything connects.

discovery.text: Peter Senge's 'The Fifth Discipline' argues that systems thinking is the cornerstone of learning organizations.

twist.text: Linear thinking causes most strategic failures. Leaders fix symptoms while the root cause keeps generating problems.

climax.text: Strategic leaders map feedback loops, identify leverage points, and intervene where small changes produce big effects.

punchline.text: Fix the system, not the symptom.

quiz.question: What is systems thinking?
options: Seeing how parts interact as a whole
